Earlier LST rise toward the northwestern Chinese Loess Plateau is highlighted with the black arrow and purple shaded areas, in line with reduced vegetation cover (lower TOC content in d) during the last glacial period. The last deglaciation into the Holocene, as indicated by the onsite MS/MGS and TOC content, and global/marine records ( d– g) is highlighted with the blue bar. The early LST rise, relative to other proxies from the same sites, is a robust feature and irrespective of chronological uncertainty. See Fig. 1 for site locations
